snippet: The appeals panel complimented Judge Shira A. Scheindlin, but continued to block her decision that had imposed sweeping changes on the police.
abstract: Federal appeals panel in Manhattan that abruptly removed Judge Shira A Scheindlin from New York City's high-profile stop-and-frisk litigation, questioning her conduct on case, issues lengthy explanation of decision; new opinion compliments Scheindlin, emphasizing  that there were no findings of misconduct, bias or partiality, but continues to block her decision that had imposed sweeping changes on New York Police Department.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: The appeals panel complimented Judge Shira A. Scheindlin, but continued to block her decision that had imposed sweeping changes on the police.

headline.main: Federal Panel Softens Tone on Judge It Removed From Stop-and-Frisk Case
headline.print_headline: Federal Panel Softens Tone on Judge It Removed From Stop-and-Frisk Case
